div.p: It’s maybe just me but I have always been a helpful sort of person, I’ll always be helping people; I mean on the way here we passed a car
that was sort of on the pavement and a woman was just standing outside and there were loads of drivers just going past but I
had to stop and check that everything was alright...
See a lot of people think that because I’m a Fire Fighter it’s all about putting out the fires and stuff like that, it’s like the hardest part of the training
for me, the hardest part of the job is the training once that’s out the way what I enjoy most from it is just interaction with people
if I’m totally honest, not saying I don’t enjoy putting out fires and that I do enjoy it but it’s not like “oh yeah I put out a fire today”
or “I cut up a car today” it’s just the interaction with people and knowing that you've made a difference, it sounds cliché but that’s what I enjoy the most.
When I was like 13 or 14 growing up I could see more people, you know, of my liking in this sort of role because you can see the
problems it gives them when they actually say to me “I want to be a Fire Fighter” or they might even say “I want to work for the Ambulance”
or I want to be you know even a Police Officer you wouldn’t even say those things back in my day.
